title: Final Drive Chain Adjustment

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Place the motorcycle on a level surface and hold it in an upright position with no weight on it.
Rotate the rear wheel by pushing the motorcycle to find the position where the drive chain has least slack. Measure the drive chain’s vertical movement, mid-way between sprockets.
If correct, the vertical movement of the drive chain mid-way between the sprockets should be
Release the lock nuts on both the left hand and right hand chain adjuster bolts.
Moving both adjusters by an equal amount, turn the adjuster bolts clockwise to increase chain free-movement and anticlockwise to reduce chain free-movement.
When the correct amount of chain free-movement has been set, push the wheel into firm contact with the adjusters.
Check for equal adjustment on both sides using the graduation marks on the swinging arm.
Tighten both adjuster lock nuts to

Repeat the chain adjustment check. Readjust if necessary.

Operation of the motorcycle with insecure adjuster lock nuts or a loose wheel spindle may result in impaired stability and handling of the motorcycle. This impaired stability and handling may lead to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

Drive Chain Free Movement Adjustment
Perform the following operations:
Loosen the wheel spindle nut.
Release the lock nuts on both the left hand and right hand chain adjuster bolts.
Adjuster bolt
Adjuster bolt lock nut
Rear wheel spindle nut
Moving both adjusters by an equal amount, turn the adjuster bolts clockwise to increase chain free-movement and anticlockwise to reduce chain free-movement.
When the correct amount of chain free-movement has been set, push the wheel into firm contact with the adjusters.
Check for equal adjustment on both sides using the graduation marks on the swinging arm.
Tighten both adjuster lock nuts to
20 Nm
and the rear wheel spindle nut to
